page.title: Florida Hospital College of Health Sciences

revisions.rev:
{{Infobox university |logo = [[File:FHCHS-Logo.png]] |name = Florida Hospital College of Health Sciences |native_name = |image = |caption = |latin_name = |motto = |mottoeng = |established = 1992 |closed = |type = [[Private university]] |affiliation = |endowment = |officer_in_charge = |chairman = |chancellor = |president = Dr. David E. Greenlaw |vice-president = |superintendent = |provost = |vice_chancellor = |rector = |dean = |director = |head_label = |head = |faculty = 64 Full Time (including non classroom teachers); 24 Adjunct; 6 Professional Faculty, and 145 clinical professors http://www.fhchs.edu/academicbulletin20092010/faculty |staff = |students = 2,600 |undergrad = |postgrad = |doctoral = |other = |city = [[Orlando, Florida|Orlando]] |state = [[Florida]] |province = |country = [[United States]] |coor = |campus = Orlando, Online, Denver |former_names = |free_label = |free = |sports = |colors = |colours = |nickname = FHCHS |mascot = |athletics = |affiliations = |website = [http://www.fhchs.edu/ www.fhchs.edu] |footnotes = }}'''Florida Hospital College of Health Sciences''' (FHCHS) is located in [[Orlando, Florida|Orlando]], [[Florida]]. It is a [[Seventh-day Adventist]] institution which specializes in allied health and nursing education. The college is associated with Florida Hospital, and [[Adventist Health System]] which is operated by the [[Seventh-day Adventist Church]].[http://www.adventisthealthsystem.com/AboutUs/ChurchAffiliation.aspx] About Adventist Health System. Retrieved 2009-12-04 ==Degree Programs== The college offers the following academic programs: === Master's Programs === [http://www.fhchs.edu/academics/nurse-anesthesia/nurse-anesthesia-program Master of Science degree in Nurse Anesthesia]
[http://www.fhchs.edu/academics/occupational-therapy/occupational-therapy-program Master's degree in Occupational Therapy] === Bachelor of Science Programs === ==== Main Campus ==== [http://www.fhchs.edu/academics/health-and-biomedical-sciences/health-and-biomedical-sciences Bachelor of Science degree in Biomedical Sciences or Health Sciences]
[http://www.fhchs.edu/academics/radiologic-sciences/nuclear-medicine-technology-program Bachelor of Science degree in Nuclear Medicine Technology] ==== Distance Education Online ==== [http://onlineimaging.fhchs.edu/dms-lpkp/ Bachelor of Science degree in Diagnostic Medical Sonography]
[http://onlinenursing.fhchs.edu/nsg-lpkp/ Bachelor of Science degree in Nursing]
[http://onlineimaging.fhchs.edu/rad-lpkp/ Bachelor of Science degree in Radiologic Sciences] === Associate of Science Programs === [http://www.fhchs.edu/academics/diagnostic-medical-sonography/diagnostic-medical-sonography-program Associate of Science in Diagnostic Medical Sonography]
[http://www.fhchs.edu/academics/nursing/nursing-program Associate of Science in Nursing]
[http://www.fhchs.edu/academics/occupational-therapy-assistant/occupational-therapy-assistant-program Associate of Science in Occupational Therapy Assistant]
[http://www.fhchs.edu/academics/health-and-biomedical-sciences/health-and-biomedical-sciences Associate of Science in Pre-Professional Studies]
[http://www.fhchs.edu/academics/radiologic-sciences/radiography-program Associate of Science in Radiography]
==Accreditation== The college is accredited through the Southern Association of Colleges and Schools as well as specific accreditation or licensing bodies for specific programs.[http://www.fhchs.edu/about/accreditation] FHCHS Accreditation ==See also== *[[List of Seventh-day Adventist colleges and universities]] * [[List of Seventh-day Adventist hospitals]] * [[Nurse education]] * [[Nurse educator]] * [[Nursing school]] * [[List of nursing credentials]] * [[Diploma in Nursing]] * [[Associate of Science in Nursing]] * [[Bachelor of Science in Nursing]] * [[Master of Science in Nursing]] * [[Doctorate in Nursing]] ==References== ==External links== *[http://www.fhchs.edu/ Florida Hospital College of Health Sciences] *[http://library.fhchs.edu R. A.
